Class CardGameMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameMessage
      • CardGameMessage

  • public class CardGameMessage
extends GameMessage
    This class is used to model the message for a network card game.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FULL
      Sent by the server to a client after a connection is established but the server is not able to serve this client because it is full.
      static int JOIN
      Sent by a client to the server when a connection is established.
      static int MOVE
      Sent by a client when the local player makes a move.
      static int MSG
      Sent by a client to the server when the local player press [ENTER] in the chat input field.
      static int PLAYER_LIST
      Sent by the server to a client when a connection is established.
      static int QUIT
      Broadcast by a server when a client loses connection to the server.
      static int READY
      Sent by a client to the server to indicate it is ready for a new game.
      static int START
      Broadcast by the server when all clients are ready for a new game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CardGameMessage(int type, int playerID, java.lang.Object data)
      Creates and returns an instance of CardGameMessage.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class GameMessage

        getData, getPlayerID, getType, setData, setPlayerID, setType

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • FULL

        public static final int FULL
        Sent by the server to a client after a connection is established but the server is not able to serve this client because it is full. In this message, playerID is -1 (not being used) and data is simply null (not being used).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JOIN

        public static final int JOIN
        Sent by a client to the server when a connection is established. In this message, playerID specifies the playerID of the player, and data is simply null (not being used).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MOVE

        public static final int MOVE
        Sent by a client when the local player makes a move. The server will broadcast this message upon receiving it. In this message, playerID specifies the player who makes the move, and data is a reference to an array of int specifying the indices of the cards being played.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MSG

        public static final int MSG
        Sent by a client to the server when the local player press [ENTER] in the chat input field. The server will first add the name, IP address and TCP port of the player into the chat message, and then broadcast the message. In this message, playerID specifies the player who sent this chat message, and data is a reference to a string containing a formated chat message.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLAYER_LIST

        public static final int PLAYER_LIST
        Sent by the server to a client when a connection is established. In this message, playerID specifies the playerID of the local player, and data is a reference to a regular array of strings specifying the names of the players
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • QUIT

        public static final int QUIT
        Broadcast by a server when a client loses connection to the server. In this message, playerID specifies the player who loses the connection to the server, and data is a string representation of the IP address and TCP port of this player.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • READY

        public static final int READY
        Sent by a client to the server to indicate it is ready for a new game. The server will also broadcast this message upon receiving it. In this message, playerID specifies the player who becomes ready for a new game (for the message broadcast by the server) or -1 (for the message sent by a client), and data is simply null (not being used).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • START

        public static final int START
        Broadcast by the server when all clients are ready for a new game. In this message, playerID is -1 (no being used), and data is a reference to a Deck object (a shuffled deck for the new game).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • CardGameMessage

        public CardGameMessage(int type,
                       int playerID,
                       java.lang.Object data)
        Creates and returns an instance of CardGameMessage.
        Parameters:
        type - the message type of this message
        playerID - the playerID of this message
        data - the data of this message
